message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.CV, cs.CL

This paper addresses the challenge of catastrophic forgetting in deep networks, which is a common problem in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The paper proposes a novel approach based on complementary learning systems theory, which involves learning a generative model that couples the current task to past learned tasks through a discriminative embedding space. This approach is relevant to several sub-fields of computer science, including machine learning (cs.LG), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), neural networks (cs.NE), computer vision (cs.CV), and natural language processing (cs.CL). However, given the focus on deep learning and sequential multitask learning, we believe that cs.LG is the most likely sub-category, followed by cs.AI and cs.NE. The relevance to computer vision and natural language processing is less clear, but these sub-categories cannot be ruled out entirely.
